title: Stock market briefly deepens dip after Chile reportedly cancels summit at which Trump and Xi were to meet
text: U.S. stocks briefly got knocked lower early Wednesday after reports surfaced that the Chilean government canceled a meeting in which President Donald Trump and his Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping were to etch out the fine points on a "phase one" trade agreement. Chile canceled the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation meeting, according to Bloomberg and AFP, citing Chilean President Sebastian Pinera. The summit was scheduled to take place Nov. 16-17. The Dow Jones Industrial Average DJIA, -0.09% was trading flat at 27,076, but had hit a low of 26,999 after the report, the S&P 500 index SPX, -0.12% was off 0.1% at 3,034 and had touched a intraday nadir at 3,025, while the Nasdaq Composite Index COMP, -0.16% retreated less than 0.1% at 8,273 and had touched a low for the early session at 8,241. A new venue for APEC will likely be picked as Chile has been dealing with protests that have escalated, possibly giving its government cause to cancel the coming international confab.
description: U.S. stocks briefly got knocked lower early Wednesday after reports surfaced that the Chilean government canceled a meeting in which President Donald Trump...
